summary: An email from Susan Harriman raising questions about Jeffrey Epstein's employment history at Bear Stearns and alleging a separate case involving a Cayman Islands hedge fund, Ivy League cardiology directors, Abbott Labs, and potential fraud linked to clinical trials.

persons.name: Susan Harriman
persons.role: Email author, former Bear Stearns employee
persons.context: Author of the email questioning Jeffrey Epstein's employment at Bear Stearns and presenting an alleged case involving a hedge fund and clinical trials.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email questions whether he was ever actually employed/licensed at Bear Stearns, as no record exists in FINRA's BrokerCheck.

persons.name: Gerardo Reyes
persons.context: Reportedly went to Colombia and obtained records related to the alleged hedge fund and clinical trial case mentioned by Harriman.

connections.description: Harriman is investigating and questioning Epstein's claimed employment history at Bear Stearns.
Harriman states that Reyes obtained records in Colombia for her regarding the alleged hedge fund case.

events.title: Email raising Epstein employment questions
events.description: Susan Harriman sends an email questioning the verification of Jeffrey Epstein's employment at Bear Stearns and presenting an unrelated alleged fraud case.

events.title: Completion of seed research clinical trials
events.description: Mention of clinical trials with a focus in cardiology being completed in 2015, allegedly linked to a hedge fund and resulting in patient deaths and hospital readmissions.

keyFacts: The email claims FINRA's BrokerCheck shows no record of Jeffrey Epstein ever being licensed to work at Bear Stearns, contrary to his reported employment history.
It alleges a separate case involving a Cayman Islands hedge fund, whose largest investor is Abbott Labs, connected to cardiology clinical trials.
The email references 26 deaths and 28,882 Medicare-reimbursed patient readmissions linked to one of the trials (Heartmate).
Journalist Gerardo Reyes of Univision reportedly obtained records in Colombia related to this alleged case.
